definition: Ba Jin (1904-2005), novelist, author of the trilogy 家, 春, 秋
Ba state during Zhou dynasty (in east of modern Sichuan)/abbr. for east Sichuan or Chongqing/surname Ba/abbr. for Palestine or Palestinian/abbr. for Pakistan

to long for/to wish/to cling to/to stick to/sth that sticks/close to/next to/spread open/informal abbr. for bus 巴士[ba1 shi4]/bar (unit of pressure)/nominalizing suffix on certain nouns, such as 尾巴[wei3 ba5], tail
gold/chemical element Au/generic term for lustrous and ductile metals/money/golden/highly respected/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
surname Jin/surname Kim (Korean)/Jurchen Jin dynasty (1115-1234)
Parkinson's disease

sentences.english: "Acceptance of the present moment has nothing to do with resignation," writes Kabat-Zinn.
sentences.chinese: “接受當下時刻與順從無關，”卡巴金寫道。

sentences.english: I have been reading Ba Jing lately.
sentences.chinese: 最近以來我一直在看巴金的作品。

sentences.english: Although 95 years old, Mr. Ba Jin is still hale and hearty.
sentences.chinese: 儘管巴金先生已經95歲了，但他仍然精神矍鑠。

sentences.english: Baggins is the wandering Hobbit who found the Ring.
sentences.chinese: 巴金斯是常在外遊歷的霍比特人，正是他撿到了魔戒。

sentences.english: I think Ba Jin ranks among the greatest writers.
sentences.chinese: 我認爲巴金可以被列入最偉大作家的行列。

sentences.english: Every success Ba Jin made can be considered to be a journey of self-fulfillment.
sentences.chinese: 巴金的每一次成功的創作都是一次自我實現的歷程。

sentences.english: Bajin is known as a great writer.
sentences.chinese: 巴金以一名偉大的作家而著名。

sentences.english: What was the relationship between the anarchism in Ba Jin's thoughts and the revolutionary democratism?
sentences.chinese: 巴金思想中的無政府主義與革命民主主義是什麼關係？

sentences.english: Chapter Six mainly discusses the translation of Ba Jin's works in France.
sentences.chinese: 第六章着重討論巴金在法國的譯介情況。

sentences.english: The etiology and pathogenesis of Parkinson's disease are still unknown.
sentences.chinese: 巴金森氏病的病因及致病機轉目前仍不清楚。

sentences.english: Bajin, one of the greatest writers in China, is regarded as "People's Writer".
sentences.chinese: 巴金，中國最著名的作家之一，被譽爲“人民作家”。

sentences.english: Jin who desire to live with the housing system reform so difficult?
sentences.chinese: 巴金的願望與住房制度改革誰令居住如此艱難？

sentences.english: Objective To assess the therapeutic effect of Depakin in intractable hiccup after stroke.
sentences.chinese: 目的觀察德巴金對卒中後頑固性呃逆的療效。

sentences.english: Tzu Chi General Hospital holds a seminar to raise awareness of Parkinson's disease.
sentences.chinese: 慈濟醫院舉辦研討會，提高各界對巴金森氏症的關注。

sentences.english: "Acceptance of the present moment has nothing to do with resignation, " writes Kabat-Zinn.
sentences.chinese: “接受當下時刻與順從無關，”卡巴金寫道。

sentences.english: I understand more about the meaning of the nom through this trip.
sentences.chinese: 巴金這一次的旅行使我更瞭解一個名詞的意義。

definition: Mao Dun (1896-1981), Chinese novelist
Lu Xun (1881-1936), one of the earliest and best-known modern Chinese writers
Lao She (1899-1966), Chinese novelist and dramatist
Cao Yu (1910-1997), PRC dramatist
Ji Xianlin (1911-2009), Chinese linguist and Indologist
Shen Congwen (1902-1988), novelist
Xiao Qian (1910-1999), Mongolian-born, Cambridge-educated journalist active during Second World War in Europe, subsequently famous author and translator
Hu Shi (1891-1962), original proponent of writing in colloquial Chinese 白話文|白话文[bai2 hua4 wen2]
Yu Dafu (1896-1945), poet and novelist
Ivan Sergeevich Turgenev (1818-1883), Russian novelist
Guo Moruo (1892-1978), writer, communist party intellectual and cultural apparatchik

Zhou Zuoren (1885-1967), brother of Lu Xun 魯迅|鲁迅, academic in Japanese and Greek studies, briefly imprisoned after the war as Japanese collaborator, persecuted and died of unknown causes during the Cultural Revolution
Xiao Hong (1911-1942), prominent woman writer, originally from Heilongjiang
Qian Zhongshu (1910-1998), literary academic and novelist, author of the 1947 novel Fortress Beseiged 圍城|围城

Qu Qiubai (1899-1935), politician, Soviet expert of the Chinese communists at time of Soviet influence, publisher and Russian translator, captured and executed by Guomindang at the time of the Long March
Zou Taofen (1895-1944), journalist, political theorist and publisher
